content.description: Start up the bolt line in the middle of the slab with a few good hands initially, this leads to some fun friction slab. Gain a small ledge which leads towards a thin flake and finally a shallow grove which leads to the anchor ledge.
content.location: This routes in the middle route on the slab. It starts right above the tin sheeting in the belay space.

content.description: Follow the bolts up the slab, past the thin horizontal crack with bushes (optional gear placement). Bolted anchor at top of slab (shared with Vanadium Miner's Daughter).
content.location: The middle bolted line on Gateway Slab.

content.description: Up a wide corner/chimney which exits to a right slanting crack to gain a ledge. Â Friction to another smaller ledge working your way right, up some hollow sounding flakes.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches.  Wide gear to 5 inches would be possible low on the route, though I did not feel it necessary. I did clip the bolt when the route merges with it's neighbor Vanadium Miner's Daughter, as placing gear in the rock creaking under my feet seemed dubious.

content.description: Follow the rounded arete. Crux moves are low down, near the first bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts (protecting the more difficult moves), gear placements to 1 inch.
content.location: The right-most route on Gateway Slab, start at the arete on the right side.

content.description: Make a move or two up Labrador Bulldog, then step up and left onto the boulder, and follow the bolts to the top, staying to the right of the arete. More features to work with than the Bolted Boulder Left, making it the easier of the two otherwise similar routes.
content.location: The right hand side of the right arete on the large boulder on the left of Gateway Slab

content.description: Climb the arete on its left hand side, smearing feet while laying off the arete. Crux is probably clipping the 4th bolt.
content.location: The left side of the right hand arete on the large boulder at the left of Gateway Slab.
